cont.entity_a: Worst customer service with long wait times. Technical support is inadequate, often requiring escalation to Tier II.
cont.entity_b: Some initial setup issues but resolved with customer service assistance.

cont.entity_a: Router reboots frequently and drops wireless connection hourly. Router frequently disconnects and reboots, unresolved by firmware updates or network card replacement. Handles ISP's PADT packet by disconnecting and rebooting. Some users experience frequent disconnections.
cont.entity_b: Router required periodic reboots and eventually stopped working. Router requires frequent resets due to connection issues. Router requires frequent reconfiguration to maintain connections.

cont.entity_a: Can only configure wireless channel 6. Advanced features are poorly documented without samples. Easy to set up if instructions are followed. Installation requires firmware update for optimal performance.
cont.entity_b: Requires running a Linksys program to add new devices, which is good for security but annoying. Setup utility had initial issues finding the router. Router setup can be complex, requiring manual adjustments. Router requires manual configuration for optimal performance. Router requires careful configuration to avoid connection issues.

cont.entity_a: LED indicators do not behave as described in manuals, complicating troubleshooting.
cont.entity_b: Dim LED lights are difficult to see.

cont.entity_a: Signal strength and quality are inconsistent. Strong signal throughout a two-story house. Router has dead spots, requiring specific positioning for a connection. Signal strength diminishes significantly beyond 10 feet. Strong signals throughout the house with reasonable speed. Works well through solid masonry walls and large appliances. Signal strength is poor beyond 40 feet. Wireless signal strength is weak, requiring specific positioning for use.
cont.entity_b: Good range and speed after replacing an older G router. Works well in a two-level house with good range. Limited range compared to older routers. Router has poor range and frequent disconnections. Product has poor range and frequent connection issues. Router has good range but limited compatibility with certain devices.

cont.entity_a: Stable connection speed of 108Mbps achieved with a Toshiba laptop using Atheros super-G wireless card. Excellent speed and stability with good range. Wireless speed is a fraction of previous routers.
cont.entity_b: Works well for wired connections with noticeable speed improvement. Provides good speed and range with the right configuration. Wireless speed is a fraction of previous routers.

cont.entity_a: Easy to set up if instructions are followed. Easy installation with an easy connection wizard. Installation is straightforward, but setup CD can be problematic. Installation requires firmware update for optimal performance.
cont.entity_b: Installation was simple without using the included software. Setup was straightforward and performance was satisfactory. Router setup was easy with good performance across devices.

cont.entity_a: Firmware upgrades require complete shutdown and restart. Latest firmware upgrade locks out Xbox Live.
cont.entity_b: Router works well after firmware update with DD-WRT. Router worked well after setup with updated firmware.

cont.entity_a: Misleading product description regarding 108Mbps speed, which is only achievable with specific D-Link products.
cont.entity_b: Router has an inconveniently placed reset button.

cont.entity_a: Compatible with VPN for company connections.
cont.entity_b: Router works well with Macs after configuration.

cont.entity_a: Offers WEP and WPA encryption and is easy to manage.

cont.entity_b: Dependable performance with various wireless devices. Consistent performance over several years.
